alert.note: Alert for Mahoning; Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 5:38AM EST until February 19 at 3:36AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Tuscarawas River At Massillon affecting Stark County. Mahoning River At Youngstown affecting Mahoning and Trumbull Counties. Mahoning River At Leavittsburg affecting Trumbull County. Mahoning River At Warren affecting Trumbull County. For the Tuscarawas River...including Massillon...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Mahoning River...including Leavittsburg, Warren, Youngstown...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Site Specific Non-forecast Pt...including Phalanx Station... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mahoning River At Youngstown. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Roads near the river in Girard and Niles in southern Trumbull County inundated. These include First and Second Streets in Niles, and River and Front Streets in Girard. Businesses south of Olive Street in McDonald inundated. Lowland in Mahoning County inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM EST Friday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 AM EST Friday was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this evening to 6.5 feet and then begin rising early Sunday morning. It will then rise again to 6.7 feet Sunday morning. It will fall to 5.5 feet and then begin rising early Tuesday morning then rise again. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.3 feet on 03/02/1910. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 315 PM EST.
